title: How is healthcare sector leveraging the Big Data technologies? - Quora

response.answer_text: One huge area of Big Data leverage is in the fight to cure cancer. Back when President Obama was in office, he enacted a Cancer Moonshot program which aimed to accomplish 10 years worth of progress towards curing cancer in 5 years. This program established a panel which would give official recommendations. As part of this panel’s recommendations, they stated that cancer-fighting institutions throughout the United States should attempt to share their research and clinical databases with each other. The motivation? When using large swathes of data, it’s possible to spot trends that could hold clues to solving cancer. For example, researchers can look at tumors held in biobanks that have different treatment records associated with them to see what treatments lead to the best patient outcomes. To read more about solving cancer with big data and 12 other big data applications in healthcare, read this post: 12 Examples of Big Data In Healthcare That Can Save People

MUCMD, the Meaningful Use of Complex Medical Data, has a great overview in its last several conferences. www.mucmd.org/ Recurrent themes include: event prediction in critical care, knowledge discovery in genetics, personalization of treatment, and organizing and characterizing data. From a research perspective, this is a great place to begin surveying the field.  At CliniCast, we have been using Big Data for a while specifically within oncology: Measurement of Quality of Care from perspective of Clinical Outcome, Cost of Care, Adherence to Guideline, Quality of Life, and Patient SatisfactionRisk Stratification of hospitalization, complications due to chemotherapy, mortalityBenchmarking patients in terms of care and costPersonalization of care pathways, particularly when deciding between surgery, chemotherapy and radiation.
